lead_paragraph: MALLARD--Henry Clay, M.D.,age 70 of New York City passed away peacefully at home on Monday, May 9, 2016. Dr. Mallard is survived by his beloved wife, Laura Osinoff Mallard, his brother and sister-in-law George and Susie Mallard, his niece Stephanie and his son Jeremy. Dr. Mallard was southern-born and educated in Alabama and Arkansas. He came to New York City in the early 70's and trained at Harlem Hospital and St. Luke's Roosevelt. Dr. Mallard served as a training and supervising analyst at New York Psychoanalytic Society and Institute, and as a psychiatric consultant to the Episcopal Diocese of New York and as Medical Director at SPOP. He also had a private practice in Manhattan. He inspired others as a teacher, supervisor, analyst, and colleague. His intellect, clinical acumen, sly humor, dedication, and strength of character will be deeply missed. Funeral services will be held on Sunday, May 15, 12 noon at "The Riverside," 76th Street at Amsterdam Ave. In lieu of flowers, the family asks that donations be made in Henry Mallard's honor to New York Psychoanalytic Society & Institute, www.nypsi.org, or to Calvary Hospice, www.calvaryhospital.org, and National Institute for the Psychotherapies, www.nipinst.org. 1/3
